qas.question: The reign of which king was a turning point in the growth of the position of prime minister?
In what year did Queen Anne die?
Who did George appoint head of the government?

context: A tipping point in the evolution of the prime ministership came with the death of Anne in <a1_0><b3_0>1714<b3_0/><a1_0/> and the accession of <a0_0>George I<a0_0/> to the throne. George spoke no <b4_0>English,<b4_0/> spent much of his time at his home in <a2_0>Hanover<a2_0/>, and had neither knowledge of, nor interest in, the details of English government. In these circumstances it was inevitable that <b5_0>the king's first minister<b5_0/> would become the de facto head of the government.
